description: Old English eastera, eastra. Compare norther, souther, wester.

adjectives.description: easter (comparative more easter, superlative most easter)

examples: In the mean while, as our apartment was a corner one, and looked both east and north, I ran to the easter casement to look after Drummond.

entries.meaning: comparative form of east: more east
A strong easterly wind (a wind blowing from the east).
examples: A northeaster in one place may be an easter, a norther, or a souther in some other locality.

verbs.description: easter (third-person singular simple present easters, present participle eastering, simple past and past participle eastered)

examples: Off Tilbury the Alcyone's topsail-yard was carried away just forward of the slings; she set a jib-headed one; at Thames Haven the wind easteredÂ ...
